summary: This document is an email or internal communication from a Chief Psychologist at the Metropolitan Correctional Center regarding Jeffrey Epstein's status after returning from court. It references a form Epstein signed with Marshals that noted 'Suicidal tendencies,' which Epstein denied, and asks whether the psychologist should see him or conduct a Suicide Risk Assessment (SRA).

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The inmate who returned from court and had to sign a form with Marshals noting 'Suicidal tendencies,' which he denied.

events.title: Epstein returns from court and signs form
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein returned from court and signed a form with Marshals that noted 'Suicidal tendencies,' which he denied.

locations.name: Metropolitan Correctional Center
locations.address: 150 Park Row, New York, New York 10007
locations.context: Federal prison where Jeffrey Epstein was held.

keyFacts: On July 31, 2019, Jeffrey Epstein returned from court and signed a form with Marshals that noted 'Suicidal tendencies.'
Epstein denied that the form indicated he was suicidal.
A Chief Psychologist at the MCC questioned whether to see Epstein or conduct a Suicide Risk Assessment (SRA).
The communication is dated August 1, 2019, the day before Epstein's death.
The document highlights concerns about Epstein's mental state and suicide risk while in custody.
